donor_name: Risk Management & Security Consultancy Co W.L.L
outputs.output_descr:
The aim of the Value Chains for Employment project is to improve the livelihoods of the people of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and specifically in the SERDA  and REDAH  regions as well as municipalities of Srebrenica, Milici and Bratunac, by producing new value or value added products, generating employment and incomes, and sustaining those currently in place. The proposed modality is the support to the creation of new value-added chains, and the strengthening of those that are currently operating in agriculture and related food processing industries, and in particular: fruit production, vegetables production and dairy processing. 
The project supports key BiH agencies to support SMEs in meeting international standards and accessing new markets (State Veterinary Office, Food Safety Agency, Institute for Standardization, Export Promotion Agency).  Parallely, support is also provided to select SMEs to increase their:
•	competitiveness on  domestic and export markets, 
•	production and 
•	employment

Furthermore, value chain provides a mechanism through which micro-producers (those that supply the SMEs; e.g. individual farmers) may participate in the gains from economic growth, and take a first, important step towards full inclusion in the formal economy. Through the symbiotic relationship between SMEs and micro-producers, incomes and employment will be increased, and poverty will be reduced.

project_descr: Value Chains for Employment strengthened and livelihoods improved
